channel.title: NPR All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Ari Shapiro, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.

item.title: How Trump may lean on personal ties with Gulf Arab leaders while in the Middle East
item.description: President Trump is on his way to the Mideast, where his personal ties with Gulf Arab rulers, family business deals and U.S. interests converge.

item.title: Trump's push to reshape the DOJ's civil rights division sparks mass exodus of attorneys
item.description: The Trump administration's effort to reshape the Justice Department's civil rights division and its mission, once the crown jewel of the department, has prompted a mass exodus of attorneys.

item.title: The Trump administration wants food makers to switch to natural dyes
item.description: The Trump administration hopes to eliminate potentially harmful synthetic dyes used to give foods, drinks and medicines vivid color. Manufacturers say it's not that simple to make the change.

item.title: A Texas park that closed during peak border crossings has reopened
item.description: More than a year after the state of Texas seized Shelby Park in the border city of Eagle Pass at the peak of illegal border crossings, the park has reopened to the public.

item.title: Hamas released the last U.S.-Israeli citizen believed to be alive and held hostage
item.description: Hamas has released the last remaining live U.S. Israeli dual citizen who has was held hostage in Gaza. The release was brokered in a deal between Hamas and the U.S.

item.title: Felony charges stemming from University of Michigan protests are dismissed for some
item.description: Many students facing criminal charges over last year's campus protests have had those charges cleared, but a handful facing felony charges at the University of Michigan had their charges dismissed.

item.title: Opening arguments begin in Sean Combs trial
item.description: The charges in Combs' federal criminal trial include sex trafficking and racketeering conspiracy. He has pleaded not guilty. If convicted of all charges, Combs could spend the rest of his life in prison.

item.title: New designers take on the 'Black Dandy'
item.description: Fashion is often described as an individualistic pursuit. But a new exhibition at the Metropolitan Museum of Art in New York explores the influence of family on the style known as Black Dandyism.

item.title: Texas Lottery faces scrutiny amid jackpot controversies and leadership shakeup
item.description: The lottery recently banned online couriers, but some state legislators are considering more regulation.

item.title: Poland preps for war
item.description: Poland expands defenses, trains citizens and partners with France to deter potential Russian invasion threats.
